long: Meaning: properly, to "pound", i.e. "smite"; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to "disperse"; also, to "thrust" off, down, out or upon (inclusively, "reject", "let alone", "permit", "remit", etc.).  Usage: cast off, drawn, let fall, forsake, join (battle), leave (off), lie still, loose, spread (self) abroad, stretch out, suffer.  Source: a primitive root;
